content.question: Let <math alttext="f" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>f</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> be the function defined by <math alttext="f of x, equals, x times cosine x, minus sine x " display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mi>f</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>=</mo><mi>x</mi><mi>cos</mi><mo>⁡</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>−</mo><mi>sin</mi><mo>⁡</mo><mi>x</mi></mrow></math>. What is the absolute maximum value of <math alttext="f" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>f</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> on the interval <math alttext="open bracket, the negative of the fraction pi over 2, comma 2 pi, close bracket " display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mo>[</mo><mrow><mrow><mo>−</mo><mfrac><mrow><mi>π</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></mfrac></mrow><mo>,</mo><mn>2</mn><mi>π</mi></mrow><mo>]</mo></mrow></math> ?

topic.text: 5.5: Using the Candidates Test to Determine Absolute (Global) Extrema

skill.text: Skill 1.E: Apply appropriate mathematical rules or procedures, with and without technology.
